meanings.definition: A device or substance used to saturate something with a particular substance.
meanings.sent1: The saturator slowly filled the sponge with water.
meanings.sent2: The saturator added color to the fabric in the dyeing process.
meanings.sent3: The saturator decided to have a water balloon fight with the garden hose.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a saturator of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The saturator poured happiness into every corner of the party.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that saturates something with a particular substance.
meanings.sent1: The chef was the saturator of flavors in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The rain was the saturator of the soil with much-needed moisture.
meanings.sent3: The movie popcorn was the saturator of the cinema with a buttery aroma.
meanings.sent4: His words were a saturator of hope in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The sun was the saturator of warmth on the cold winter day.
